send_to_cs: Send to CS for post purchase inquiries, use PPI shortcut
Send to CS immediately for Authorized Retailers
templates: For wrong/damaged items use WDI shortcut
For cxs reaching out from the UK, use UKD shortcut

241.SystemMessage1: Luminox Watches: Welcome to Luminox Watches! Msg & data rates may apply. Msg frequency varies. Reply HELP for help, STOP to cancel.
241.SystemMessage2: Luminox Watches: Hi there, this is Taylor. How can I help you?
241.customerMessage1: I was given a watch, but the band is too small. How do I find about getting extra links to make sure the band fits?
241.AgentMessage1: Luminox Watches: Thanks for reaching out! Could you let me know which watch you received? I'd like to check if there are any extra links available to adjust the fit for you. I'm here to help!
241.AgentMessage2: Luminox Watches: Thanks for the photo! I'll check with my team and get back in touch once I have an update. Hang tight!
241.AgentMessage3: Luminox Watches: Thank you. It's a little late, so it's likely I won't hear back by today, though rest assured, I'll reach out once business hours resume. Have a great night!
241.customerMessage6: No problem, thanks. You as well.
241.AgentMessage4: Luminox Watches: You're welcome! I'll keep you posted.
241.AgentMessage5:
Luminox Watches: Thanks for your patience! I just heard from the team, and we understand how important this is. Unfortunately, Luminox does not sell any parts. However, our authorized repair centre may be able to help you identify the part you are looking for.
 
Please see their contact information below:
 
Saltzman's Watches
e-mail: info@saltzmans-watches.com
phone: 401-735-2741 

If you have any further questions or need assistance, please don't hesitate to contact me. We're here to help!
241.customerMessage7: Do they make a larger size?
241.customerMessage8: It's a new watch that does not fit it does not require a repair
241.customerMessage9: Is that the only repair shop, I am in San Diego, not Rhode Island
241.AgentMessage6: Luminox Watches: Thanks for clarifying! Luminox does offer larger-sized watches (including 45mm and above), so if the fit isn't right, exploring those models may be a better option than repair.
241.customerMessage10: How would I know if they will fit
241.AgentMessage7:
Luminox Watches: We can't guarantee an item would fit, but I'd recommend using our size guide to determine the best size dial for your wrist: https://luminox.attn.tv/aBIXqeKG1dv_ Just print at 100%, cut out the sizes you're considering, and hold up to your wrist to find the perfect fit.

Also, we don't sell any extra links on our website, which is why we advise you contact our authorized repair centre to confirm if they can adjust the size for you. We only have one repair center at this time.

important: When sending a link, if you see a "/" at the end of the URL, remove it
escalate: ESC immediately if the order is delivered, but cx did not receive it
ESC if cx wants to use an expired code
ESC if the cx code shows the error "not valid"
Before ESC for retroactive discount requests, check if the item is on sale or if they met the minimum
Don't make suggestions of replacements - if unsure, ESC
ESC if cx state they regret placing the order after the CANCEL/ORDER temp has been sent
Before ESC products not functioning properly
Don't ask for the cx's shipping address as secondary info, include their phone number instead
tone: Keep messages shorter and more direct
Don't use the term "cart tracking", or let cxs know we can see what they have in their cart
templates: If the cx asks where there order is, and it's a confirmed order within the standard processing and shipping time, only share the "Order status/order tracking" temp
If the cx reaches out saying they're having issue with their code, first use CWW temp
If cx needs assistance with brush function/operations use FOQ shortcut
For product complaints/bad experiences use PBE shortcut
If cx says they're dentists/hygienists & want to shop use RDH shortcut
If cx is a short amount away from reaching the $100 threshold for the welcome discount to apply use SRT shortcut
If cx ask why their order was canceled, use MOC shortcut
If cx purchased from their dentist and looking for rebate ($30, $20, $10 back) use RBT shortcut
For post-purchase issues with Amazon orders, use PS shortcut
For post-purchase issues where cxs are dental professionals, dentists, hygienists, use DPS shortcut
dos_and_donts: If customers are looking for brush heads always confirm what type of brush they have, iO or non iO
If you can't find the products on the website, refer to this one https://crest.com/en-us
Hold to policy and do not offer to check if deviation from policy is acceptable
If customers ask about the warranty registration code OR say it's not accepting theirs (they might refer to it as a promo code for registration)- send them this one OB59185 (it's always the same)
drive_to_purchase: For general recommendations use CFR shortcut
Always refer cxs to iO series products, when possible
promo_and_exclusions: The $85 welcome promo code isn't for % off, once applied a free item is added to the cart
Please check the last letters of a code to determine when they were sent
Discount codes do not work on Amazon
